intro: Silene caryophylloides subsp. subulata, commonly known as the slender catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, needle-like leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Silene caryophylloides subsp. subulata is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
